page.title: 10WALNEY LIGHTHOUSE
page.content: { This Lighthouse offers protection from the dangerous sandbanks of this area of Morecambe Bay.It is run by Britain's only female Lighthouse-keeper,Peggy Braithwaite. The building of this Lighthouse began in 1788 and was completed in 1790,the structure being made of white sandstone.The Lighthouse is owned by the Port of Lancaster Commissioners. Originally the main light was operated by a clockwork mechanism,now this has been replaced by an electric one. As well as the light the Lighthouse operates a radio-beacon for Trinity House.
